	if(i == 15241)
	(

            class8.anInt174 = 48465;

            class8.anInt204 = 0;

            class8.anInt194 = -1;
            class8.anInt175 = -1;
            class8.anInt197 = -1;
            class8.anInt165 = 48465;
            class8.anInt200 = 48465;

Btw no need to be an ass hole about it =p, im not good with this stuff, yes it may be common sense but i can’t help it =/, sorry man.[/quote]
k ill be nice, the problem is the ( and ) is supposed to be { and }… idiot

item.title: Hand Cannon[317 fitted]
item.dc:creator: @Danielplanto Danielplanto
item.description:
@Danielplanto wrote:

[quote=“Motokid126, post:25, topic:303722”]Obviously i am =p

	if(i == 15241)
	(
            class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
            class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
            class8.anInt174 = 48152;
            class8.anInt174 = 48465;
            class8.anInt181 = 2151;
            class8.anInt190 = 1188;
            class8.anInt198 = 1944;
            class8.anInt204 = 0;
            class8.anInt169 = -1;
            class8.anInt194 = -1;
            class8.anInt175 = -1;
            class8.anInt197 = -1;
            class8.anInt165 = 48465;
            class8.anInt200 = 48465;
            class8.aString170 = "Hand Cannon";
            class8.aByteArray178 = "A miniature dwarven cannon.".getBytes();
    )

I don’t see it lol.

Btw no need to be an ass hole about it =p, im not good with this stuff, yes it may be common sense but i can’t help it =/, sorry man.[/quote]

I can tell you one huge issue with your code. the int174 is the drop model, you cannot have TWO drop models O.O thats why 1 was commented out. it should be more like

if(i == 15241) ( class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 48152; //class8.anInt174 = 48465; class8.anInt181 = 2151; class8.anInt190 = 1188; class8.anInt198 = 1944; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt165 = 48465; class8.anInt200 = 48465; class8.aString170 = "Hand Cannon"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A miniature dwarven cannon.".getBytes(); )

Thats probably why your client freezes. However, if your client DOES requiring gzipping i suggest you download 7zip and gzip them. Also you probably forgot to add model, but idk if your using a similar client to me. The ID can be over 15000, but the MODEL NUMBER can’t be over 15k. so for int165, int200, and int174 – if I am right, gzip the files into a .gz file, and name the gz files something like 13949 and 13858 or something, and then make sure to change them respectively, and then when you log into ur server type exactly the way as shown but w.o quotes:
“add model #####” and “add model #####” replacing the #s with the numbers of the models you made them.

Read full topic
